intro: Cacalia ovata, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Its flowers are yellow and surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cacalia ovata typically grows in meadows and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils.
